googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.earlyVotingNotesCombined: * In the 20 days leading up to Election Day, you can vote in person at your city or town hall during their regular business hours.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRulesCombined:
* Any registered Rhode Island voter can request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
* For the November 3, 2020 election, every registered voter will receive an absentee ballot application in the mail.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: Rhode Island voters must include their Rhode Island driver's license number or state ID number and the last 4 digits of their social security number with their online voter registration application.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Rhode Island voters must provide their Rhode Island driver's license number, state ID number, or the last four digits of their social security number with their voter registration application.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Rhode Island you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of Rhode Island for 30 days preceding the next election
  * be 18 years old by Election Day
  * not be currently incarcerated in a correctional facility due to a felony conviction
  * not have been lawfully judged to be mentally incompetent
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.earlyVotingByMailInfoCombined: * In the 20 days leading up to Election Day, you can vote in person at your city or town hall during their regular business hours.
